articles.author: Daniel Roberts
articles.description: All eyes in crypto are on the merge—and not just the Ethereum crowd. The event matters for Bitcoiners and everyone else.
articles.title: The Ethereum Merge Matters for Everyone in Crypto

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The renown Bitcoiner believes some of the top coin's advocates have strayed away from the network's ethos.
articles.title: ‘Fire and Brimstone’ Bitcoin Maxis Are Being Unrealistic: Dan Held

articles.author: Abigail Carlson
articles.description: Not every digital artwork needs to be an NFT. After all, NFTs can already do so much more.
articles.title: It's Time to Separate NFTs From Digital Art

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: Coin Center’s Peter Van Valkenburgh also dropped the bombshell that while U.S. citizens may not be able to use Tornado Cash, the government still can.
articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Gensler May Want Ethereum Under SEC Control, Tonga to Make Bitcoin Legal Tender

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: Created by Decentraland alumni, “Big Time” wants to be a “second-generation crypto game.” But whether mainstream gamers will pick it up remains to be seen.
articles.title: Could ‘Big Time’ Change the Trajectory of Crypto Gaming?

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The feature was floated among Web3 employees and became implemented in less than a couple of weeks.
articles.title: Google Is Counting Down to Ethereum Merge with 'Easter Egg' on Search Engine

articles.description: The years-anticipated Ethereum Merge is less than a week away. Everyone is buzzing about what it will mean for the crypto market and for proof of work vs proof of stake, but what will the effect be on NFTs? Dan Roberts, Andrew Hayward, Kate Irwin and Sander Lutz break it down in our latest live roundtable.
articles.title: #DecryptLIVE: What the Ethereum Merge Means for NFTs

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: DeFi degens are borrowing ETH in the hopes of getting airdropped a new coin if there's a fork after the merge. Now pools are limiting the borrowing.
articles.title: Why DeFi Speculators Are Borrowing Ethereum as Merge Looms

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: The new British government sounds bullish on crypto, while discussions in Washington about regulation are intensifying.
articles.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Rebound, LUNA Moons

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The firm filed with the SEC to sell up to $500 million in Class A stock. Guess what it may want to spend the proceeds on.
articles.title: MicroStrategy Is Considering Buying Even More Bitcoin

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: The network’s 13th and final shadow fork executed today with no apparent issues, say Ethereum core devs.
articles.title: Ethereum Successfully Deploys Final Network Test Before Merge

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: U.S. senators have written a letter to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, questioning the company’s commitment to stamping out crypto scams on Facebook.
articles.title: Warren, Sanders and Other Senators Demand Meta Do More to Combat Crypto Scams

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: LUNA is crypto’s largest gainer today among the top 100 coins—and it comes right after LUNA Classic had its own unexpected ascent.
articles.title: Terra Comeback? LUNA Surges 166% After LUNA Classic’s Own Rise

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: Analysts say cbETH works differently than its competitors, and that may make it less appealing.
articles.title: Coinbase’s Ethereum Staking Token Is Trading at a Discount—Here’s Why

articles.description: Jackson Palmer, who co-created Dogecoin, fired shots at the “Shark Tank” entrepreneur, saying Cuban had been “indoctrinated” into crypto.
articles.title: Mark Cuban Responds to Dogecoin Founder Diss: 'Everyone Can Say What They Want, I’m Still a Huge Fan of Crypto'

articles.description: The battle over Secret Network's Tarantino NFTs—with one already sold for $1.1M—is finished, with a possible collaboration with Miramax teased.
articles.title: Quentin Tarantino, Miramax Settle Lawsuit Over 'Pulp Fiction' NFTs

articles.author: Andrew Throuvalas
articles.description: Dictionary publisher Merriam-Webster added a fresh batch of crypto terms to its lexicon, like "Altcoin," "Metaverse," and "Unbanked."
articles.title: Merriam-Webster Adds ‘Metaverse’ and ‘Altcoin’ to Dictionary in Nod to Crypto

articles.description: Several metaverse tokens, including ApeCoin, Flow, Axie Infinity, and Flow, are enjoying sizable gains over the past day.
articles.title: ApeCoin Leads NFT, Metaverse Token Rally With Double-Digit Gains

articles.description: The gaming startup has backing from Polygon, Dapper Labs, and other prominent names.
articles.title: Revolving Games Raises $13.2 Million to Develop ‘AAA Quality’ Web3 Games

articles.description: The Treasury official backed the Truss government’s intention to turn the UK into “a global hub for crypto technologies.”
articles.title: Economic Secretary Wants UK to Be ‘Country of Choice’ for Crypto Space

articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried's FTX Ventures has reportedly acquired a 30% stake in Anthony Scaramucci's SkyBridge Capital.
articles.title: FTX Ventures Scoops Up 30% Stake in Scaramucci's SkyBridge Capital

articles.description: Sky Mavis has added Google to its growing roster of firms to help secure the gaming-centric Ethereum sidechain network.
articles.title: Google Cloud to Validate Transactions on Axie Infinity’s Ronin Network

articles.description: Bitcoin, the market's largest cryptocurrency, hit a two-week high Friday morning, outperforming most of the other top tokens.
articles.title: Bitcoin Reclaims Key $20,000 Mark Amid Crypto Market Rebound

articles.description: Joshua David Nicholas convinced investors that a high-tech bot was helping to earn them daily returns.
articles.title: Florida Man Pleads Guilty to Stealing $100 Million in Crypto Ponzi Scheme

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: After releasing dozens of pixel portraits of the late monarch in recent months, the Nouns NFT fork will close its initial collection.
articles.title: Queen Elizabeth II Ethereum NFT Tribute Project Holds Final Auction

articles.description: The ENS says losing control of eth.link puts key services “under threat.”
articles.title: Ethereum Name Service Creator Sues GoDaddy Over Expired Domain

articles.description: About 10% of the crypto funds snatched from Axie’s Ronin network have now been seized by law enforcement, according to Chainalysis.
articles.title: Investigators Recover $30M in Stolen Crypto From Axie Infinity Hack

articles.description: The White House has said it wants federal agencies and states to make mining cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin more climate-friendly—or else.
articles.title: White House: Bitcoin Mining Must Be Greener—Or US Should Ban It

articles.description: Animoca, a leading investment firm and NFT game publisher, just added to its coffers via some fresh institutional investors.
articles.title: Web3 Investor Animoca Brands Raises Another $110M for Open Metaverse

articles.description: While Gensler has previously said Bitcoin is a commodity, he’s kept quiet about the status of Ethereum.
articles.title: SEC Chair Gary Gensler Backs Giving CFTC Bitcoin Oversight

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: "Code is speech and free speech is a constitutional right worth protecting," one of the plaintiffs said.
articles.title: Coinbase Backs Tornado Cash Lawsuit Against U.S. Treasury

articles.description: Eat your Decrypt-O’s! In the debut episode, Sander Lutz hits the street to ask people about their privacy concerns in the wake of the government’s Tornado Cash crackdown; Kate Irwin shares headlines on the wackiest Web3 stories, from Crypto.com sending a woman $10 million by accident to Eminem and Snoop Dogg getting Twitter hate for their Bored Apes; and Dan Roberts serves up a rant about Gary Gensler.
articles.title: Decrypt-O's Ep. 1: Tornado Cash Privacy Fears, Bored Ape VMAs Hate, Sheriff Gensler

articles.author: Ben Munster
articles.description: The Crypto Policy Symposium in London was a historic gathering of crypto skeptics—and nobody tried to sell me anything.
articles.title: Inside the World's First No-Coiner Conference

articles.author: Sujith Somraaj
articles.description: MakerDAO could begin earning a yield on its stablecoin reserves, but turning to Coinbase raises centralization concerns.
articles.title: Coinbase’s Stablecoin Proposal Expected to Earn MakerDAO $24M Annually

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Are social tokens ready for their moment in the crypto spotlight? Roll believes the tech is on the verge of enabling breakout adoption.
articles.title: Roll Upgrades Ethereum Social Token Platform With Memberships, Staking

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: Led by Multicoin Capital, the fundraising round will expand support for USDH across the Solana network.
articles.title: Hubble, Creator of ‘Censorship Resistant’ Stablecoin USDH, Raises $5 Million

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: As many as 70,000 people tuned in to watch a phony live stream purporting to be about Apple's metaverse and crypto plans.
articles.title: Thousands Tune in to Fake Apple Crypto Scheme on YouTube: Report

articles.author: Stephen Graves
articles.description: Based on her film "She Will," Charlotte Colbert’s NFT will appear as part of an exhibition by female artists, with the proceeds going to charity.
articles.title: ‘She Will’ Director Launches NFT in Support of End Violence Against Women

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Amid the shaky crypto market outlook, Ethereum is now trading at the year’s high against Bitcoin, with the merge event just around the corner.
articles.title: Ethereum Hits Fresh 2022 High Against Bitcoin as Merge Event Approaches

articles.author: Emily Tonelli
articles.description: In an effort to meet the “growing demand” from institution investors, SEBA is turning to Ethereum staking ahead of the merge.
articles.title: Switzerland’s SEBA Bank Launches Institutional Ethereum Staking

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Court filings claim the cryptocurrency exchange artificially inflated the price of its native CEL token.
articles.title: Celsius Had Been Insolvent Since 2019: Vermont Regulator

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: The market cap gap between Tether and USDC had narrowed to $10 billion earlier this year.
articles.title: Tether’s Lead Over USDC Hits $16B as Binance Moves to Limit Stablecoin Competitors

articles.description: Dan Held is an old-school Bitcoiner who has been in the space since the very beginning; he sold his price app ZeroBlock to Blockchain.info in 2013. But while he's largely seen as a Bitcoin maximalist by his half a million fans on Twitter, he tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott he's a "permissive" and "open-minded" Bitcoiner: he's watching the Ethereum Merge closely, and he admits Ethereum's move to proof of stake will put pressure on Bitcoin's energy use. Watch Episode 18 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Bitcoiner Dan Held Talks Ethereum Merge, PoW vs PoS, and NFTs

articles.description: Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, Jason Nelson, and Sander Lutz break down all the angles, from the timing to the expected market reaction to the technical elements.
articles.title: #DecryptLIVE: Ethereum Merge Is on the Horizon

articles.description: Baek Kim of Hashed, Grace Isford of Lux Capital, Sarah Kunst of Cleo Capital, Peter Najarian of RW3 Ventures, and Edward Moncada of Protofund talk to Decrypt's Dan Roberts onstage at FTX's Crypto Bahamas event about VCs and family offices allocating money into crypto and the outlook for institutional DeFi.
articles.title: VCs and Family Offices Go Crypto: Hashed, Lux, Cleo, RW3 and Protofund at Crypto Bahamas

articles.description: Scott Hansen aka Tycho, the musician, producer, and songwriter, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin how he caught the crypto bug and why he believes Web3 can change the music industry for the better.
articles.title: From Silk Road to Buying ETH: How Musician Tycho Went Crypto

articles.description: Decentralized Pictures, the nonprofit co-founded by Roman Coppola, is enabling on-chain voting to greenlight and fund film projects. CEO Leo Matchett tells Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves how the anti-crypto stigma in Hollywood is fading, how Web3 can bring more diversity to the film world and disrupt the traditional gatekeepers, and how he first got into crypto when he and Coppola set up a Bitcoin miner in an empty sound stage.
articles.title: gm: Decentralized Pictures CEO on How Web3 Can Change Hollywood

articles.description: In this video, we’ll learn about a core component that defines Web3: blockchain nodes. A node is one of the many computers that power a decentralized network like Ethereum. Learn about the different types of nodes and why they’re part of the core infrastructure that make Web3 possible. Visit Infura.io today to start building. Written by: Clarissa Watson, Senior Tech Writer at ConsenSys.
articles.title: Decrypt Learn: What Is a Node?

articles.description: In this episode of Decrypt on the Street, reporter Sander Lutz jumps through hoops in the hopes of obtaining an exclusive "NFTiff" from Tiffany & Co. Sander learns manners and spiritual awareness from two coaches, only to fall short of the digital brass ring.
articles.title: Decrypt on the Street: An NFT Trip to Tiffany's, a Search for Status
